Operations Memo

Preventing Unsanctioned Vertical Detainment Since 1998

Groundline Assurance Bureau advises property owners, unions, schools, and hospitality groups on how to reduce occupant exposure to enclosed lift incidents. Our analysts map every chokepoint between lobby and landing, then produce practical rerouting plans that keep people moving on their own terms.

From the Journal: Writing Stairwell Signage People Actually Follow

Our editorial desk reviewed 600 signage photos across client properties and found one common pattern: directional language succeeds when it is specific, immediate, and emotionally neutral. Avoid passive phrases. Use time-based cues. Make route names human.

Policy Corner: Insurance Carriers and Delay Event Terminology

New underwriter guidance increasingly distinguishes between mechanical interruption and occupant detainment risk. We now include dual-category annotation in every monthly packet to reduce claim ambiguity.
